title: Pro Union sentiment in the Civil War South - why

content.prompt: At the outbreak of the Civil War in 1861, pro-Union sentiment was strong in western Virginia, eastern Tennessee, and western North Carolina primarily because

choices.label: Confederate troops had committed atrocities to terrorize state representatives from these regions into voting for secession
these regions had more trade with the North than did other regions in the South
these regions were more industrialized than other regions of the South
there were relatively few slaves or large plantations in these regions
Lincoln had promised not to send federal troops into these regions
